question: One caveat with bulk ATAC-seq is?

answers.answer: Chromatin signal is averaged for all cells in a sample, limiting insights into low-abundance phenotypes or rare populations of cells.
answers.feedback: Yes. scATAC-seq enables researchers to interrogate the chromatin landscape of hundreds to thousands of individual cells at the single-cell level.

answers.answer: Low cell viability causes unreliable cell recovery.
answers.feedback: Not quite. Bulk ATAC-seq represents abundance of chromatin, therefore, is not a caveat.

answers.answer: Analyze chromatin accessibility in thousands of individual cells per sample.
answers.feedback: Not quite. bulk ATAC-seq analyzes the chromatin signal in aggregates.

answers.answer: As compared to single-cell, bulk ATAC-seq technology requires much more starting material.
answers.feedback: Not quite. The ATAC-seq protocol requires only about 50,000 cells as starting material.
